title: Ghostcrawler, I am disappoint...
body: Pyke has what appears to be shark jaw_bones_ on his shoulders. How could you let this happen, Greg?

replies.body: The Rift Scuttler has the wrong number of legs, and the whale shark in WoW had big teeth. I try not to be that guy too often. :)

Vashj'ir is still my favorite zone in WoW though, even if the whale shark isn't entirely correct. :P

I wish you didn't leave WoW though, the new guy made the game so boring. >.>

I quit wow around the same time GC left. Good times were had, but nothing lasts forever ya know?

My favorite zone was Valley of the Four Winds. It had everything! The zone had settings for where the panda's worked, slept, ate and trained. It gave you a career track, complete with a personal student after you became a head chef. It even gave you your own plot of land to build up a home, complete with elements of Harvest moon/ Animal Crossing on friendships and home/ garden customization
I quit soon after he left too. When the 6.0 prepatch dropped, and all my favorite classes just stopped existing... I was done. I tried Legion for a few weeks, but the game just isn't any fun anymore.

Yea, I was part of a 4 man group for years. We'd take breaks but inevitably come back for expansions. We all bought Flag of Ownership cards and would run around zerging BG's between raids and such, dropping our flags in unison. 

Things ended on a sour note in the end, but I still have my Flag of Ownership " Owned" Card on the shelf in honor of the good times. Now that we've all gone our separate ways, It feels like a treasured Piece of the Tri...Quadra-Force we once were 

{{sticker:galio-happy}}

Haha, I can't say I have any interesting stories like that. I've always played games alone, so I never had a steady guild or group of friends like that. I just enjoyed the game, and it was a nice escape from reality.

Though I did turn into an armchair therapist and stop a guy from killing himself. That was interesting. :P

I still have fond memories of our very brief foray into the biology of Dunkleosteus. <3
Wait.... the Whale shark has teeth? How come I never noticed this?{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Yes, it was about sharks not having bones. And yes I did think about the fantasy world angle but there's nothing to indicate sharks are fundamentally different. The jaws on Pyke even appear to be from a tiger shark given the shape of the teeth.

However, I did some more research after waking up and it turns out shark jaws can be preserved when treated properly.

The other part of the joke is that Greg Street (Ghostcrawler) is a former marine biologist so even though he has no involvement in the creative process of League's development he'd be the guy to know the most about the sharks.
Hmm... Was my joke too obscure? Will I have to explain it and in doing so, kill it?

Is your joke related with sharks having no bones? They having cartiloginous skeleton?

If that's it, it is Runeterra. I doubt sharks are what we know in this world when it has leviathans bigger than any blue whales by far.
